The hot tub was very cloudy with a lot of debris, no big deal there’s a skimmer net and some spray to add if it’s too foamy. We cleaned and cleaned, decided to just get in and see how it felt, we REMOVED the floating chlorine so we could enjoy the jets and because the chemical smell was so strong it burned your eyes. We got in, did not enjoy the cloudy and vert foamy water (tried the spray) that didn’t work, so we got out and covered it back up. Next morning hot tub guy comes by to service the tub, we sat outside and talked with him about leaving the floater out and that the water is super cloudy and foamy. He informed us the chemical levels were okay and we could leave the chlorine floater out but make sure to put it in before we leave. Even after the cleaning and service from him the water was still not clear at all and we decided we just wouldn’t use it again, no big deal. We check out, get home, and I get a request to pay for the draining of the hot tub because we left the chlorine out; which we replaced it before we left like the hot tub maintenance man instructed. If we had known that we would get a $175 draining fee only because we left the floater out, I would not let it out and if I had known it was really that big of a deal I wouldn’t go against what is asked knowingly. I try to be respectful of other people and their property. The hot tub is not drained after each guest, which I do find a bit off putting, all the other cabins with hot tubs have always drained after each guest and you can definitely tell the difference. Fee paid, because I’ll pay it forward to the next guest, you’ll have a clean hot tub.
